*div1 type="summary"* *p*Asa Hoxey to Robert M, Williamson, Montgomery, Ala., December 2, 1832. Emigration to Texas. Nullification in South Carolina.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Montgomery */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="12-02-1832">Decr. 2d. 1832*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Robert M. Williamson, Esqr*/person_mentioned**/p*.
*p*Dr. Sir Your esteemed favour of *date_mentioned n="11-01-1832">Nov 1st*/date_mentioned* has come to hand, It gives me great pleasure to find that you are so faithfull to your promise of detailing the various affairs of our *location_mentioned*adopted country*/location_mentioned*— Such is the difficulty in winding up a ten years unsettled business that it will be impossible for me to leave the *location_mentioned*United States*/location_mentioned* before *date_mentioned n="09-xx-1833">September next*/date_mentioned* I allso will have to make a trip to *location_mentioned*Virginia */location_mentioned*for the purpose of adding to my stock of *person_mentioned*Slaves */person_mentioned*which will take up so much of my time that I cannot Start sooner than the period mentioned You may look with a great deal of certainty for many of your old *person_mentioned*acquaintances */person_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="Spring - 1833">next Spring*/date_mentioned* the Spirit for emigration to that *location_mentioned*Country */location_mentioned*is very great and thousands would go but for the terrors of a *person_mentioned*Mexican government*/person_mentioned* these idle fears I have endeavored as much as possible to allay and I belive with much success except with some of the more timid. You mentioned in your last letter that you belived *location_mentioned*Mexican grants of Eleven leagues*/location_mentioned* could be procured for a reasonable sum if so you will perceve by the enclosed proposition that *person_mentioned*Mr Edward Hanrick George Whitman and myself*/person_mentioned* are disposed to procure some of them the Selections of which will be left entirely to your own discretion and should you be disposed to take up with the proposition I feel satisfied that we will be well pleased with your selections In consequence of the disturbances in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* the *person_mentioned*Messrs Prichards*/person_mentioned* have declined their journey untill another year *person_mentioned*Mr Beard*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Thompson */person_mentioned*have started to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*and no doubt will arrive ere this*/p*
*p*The Political news of the*location_mentioned* United States*/location_mentioned* is that *person_mentioned*Jackson */person_mentioned*has been re-ellected *person_mentioned*President */person_mentioned*by an overwhelming *person_mentioned*majority*/person_mentioned*— *location_mentioned*South Carolina*/location_mentioned* has nullified the Tariff acts; which is to take place in*date_mentioned n="02-xx-1833"> February next*/date_mentioned*, provided *person_mentioned*Congress */person_mentioned*does not abandon the protection system by that time and in case of any interference on the part of the *location_mentioned*united states*/location_mentioned* to enforce the laws She has declared her determination to Secede we expect stormy times in the *location_mentioned*United States*/location_mentioned*, perhaps civil war which God avert Your brother *person_mentioned*Michael Williamson*/person_mentioned* died a few weeks ago and *person_mentioned*Col Peacock */person_mentioned*has taken *location_mentioned*home */location_mentioned*his *person_mentioned*widow */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*children*/person_mentioned*—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Asa Hoxey*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Robert M. Willaimson Esqr.*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San Fillippe De Austin Texas Mexico*/location_mentioned* (Via *location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned*)*/p*
*/div1*
